title.value: Unified gene expression signature of novel NPM1 exon 5 mutations in acute myeloid leukemia
title.justification: The title is directly presented at the beginning of the paper and succinctly describes the main focus of the research.
title.quote: Unified gene expression signature of novel NPM1 exon 5 mutations in acute myeloid leukemia

extractions.description: This paper discusses the transcriptomic profile of AML with mutations in nucleophosmin (NPM1), focusing on novel NPM1 exon 5 mutations and examining their gene expression signatures in the context of acute myeloid leukemia.

type.justification: The paper includes empirical evidence from the analysis of 430 AML samples to identify the gene expression signature and novel mutations.
type.quote: Workflow for sequencing, mutation analysis, and transcripts quantification has been described previously and is detailed in the supplementary Methods.

name.justification: The primary focus of the paper is on analyzing gene expression data and identifying genetic mutations in the context of leukemia, which is a key area in medical genomics.
name.quote: Acute myeloid leukemia (AML) is characterized by a diverse cytogenetic and mutational landscape.

name.justification: The paper discusses the computational methods like EPCY used for analyzing gene expression data.
name.quote: EPCY was used to identify differentially expressed transcripts that are predictive of NPM1 mutation status (https://github.com/iric-soft/epcy).

name.justification: The study is conducted in the context of acute myeloid leukemia, a type of cancer that affects the blood and bone marrow.
name.quote: Acute myeloid leukemia (AML) is characterized by a diverse cytogenetic and mutational landscape.

name.justification: The paper mentions GEO accession numbers for sequencing data.
name.quote: All sequencing data are available at GEO under accession numbers GSE106272, GSE49642, GSE52656, GSE62190, GSE66917, and GSE67039.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The datasets are part of the GEO public repository, so there isn't a specific paper referenced.
referenced_paper_title.quote: All sequencing data are available at GEO under accession numbers GSE106272, GSE49642, GSE52656, GSE62190, GSE66917, and GSE67039.

name.justification: The paper explicitly states the use of samples collected by the Quebec Leukemia Cell Bank.
name.quote: All 430 AML samples were collected with informed consent between 2001 and 2015 according to Quebec Leukemia Cell Bank procedures.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The dataset is a collection of samples rather than a dataset linked to a specific publication.
referenced_paper_title.quote: All 430 AML samples were collected with informed consent between 2001 and 2015 according to Quebec Leukemia Cell Bank procedures.

name.justification: EPCY is specifically mentioned as a tool used in the paper to identify differentially expressed transcripts.
name.quote: EPCY was used to identify differentially expressed transcripts that are predictive of NPM1 mutation status (https://github.com/iric-soft/epcy).

referenced_paper_title.justification: EPCY is a software tool mentioned without reference to a specific publication.
referenced_paper_title.quote: EPCY was used to identify differentially expressed transcripts that are predictive of NPM1 mutation status (https://github.com/iric-soft/epcy).
